alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 12:53PM PST until February 23 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with local amounts up to 10 inches. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains, and Southern Oregon Cascades. This includes Highway 138, Diamond Lake Junction on Highway 230, Highways 62, 140, 66, and 58. Interstate 5. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow covered roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Road snow accumulation is more likely at night, then the chance for additional road snow decreases shortly after daybreak Thursday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
